senses.de: The act of helping or doing work for someone
senses.ex: He has been of great service to the community.

Tips.title: Act of Support
Tips.description: Use 'service' to talk about providing help or support, typically in a professional setting.
Tips.example: I appreciate your service in resolving my issue.

Tips.title: Non-Tangible Contribution
Tips.description: 'Service' often refers to non-physical help, like advice or support, rather than just giving items.
Tips.example: Her financial advice was a valuable service to our company.

senses.de: A system supplying a public need such as transport, communications, or utilities like electricity and water
senses.ex: Public services are very important for society.

Tips.title: Essential Systems
Tips.description: 'Service' can describe essential systems provided by organizations, often related to infrastructure.
Tips.example: The city's waste management service is very efficient.

Tips.title: Community Impact
Tips.description: When used for public service, it implies something that benefits the entire community.
Tips.example: Improving education is an important public service.

senses.ex: We attend the church service every Sunday.

Tips.title: Religious Context
Tips.description: In religious context, 'service' refers to formal ceremonies with structured activities and rituals.
Tips.example: The funeral service was solemn and respectful.

Tips.title: Worship Gathering
Tips.description: Use 'service' to talk about a group gathering for collective worship or religious observances.
Tips.example: The weekly service brings our community together.

senses.de: The action of serving food and drinks to people
senses.ex: The service in this restaurant is excellent.

Tips.title: Food Presentation
Tips.description: In dining, 'service' can refer to the manner in which food and drinks are presented to guests.
Tips.example: Room service at the hotel includes a full breakfast menu.

Tips.title: Dining Experience
Tips.description: Good 'service' in restaurants implies attentive and courteous treatment by staff.
Tips.example: We left a big tip because the service was outstanding.

senses.de: The armed forces of a country
senses.ex: He is doing his national service in the army.

Tips.title: Duty to Country
Tips.description: 'Service' can mean serving in the military, a patriotic act of duty to one's country.
Tips.example: Her years of service in the Navy are commendable.

Tips.title: Professional Commitment
Tips.description: Military 'service' is a career or a period of time committed to military life.
Tips.example: His service record shows participation in multiple peacekeeping missions.

Aid.wordDefinition:
Aid generally refers to help or assistance provided to someone in need, often in the form of material or financial support.

Both aid and service can be provided in a variety of contexts, from personal relationships to business transactions to international aid efforts.

The main difference is that aid is typically offered without an expectation of payment or exchange, while service is provided as part of a formal agreement or arrangement.

Assistance.wordDefinition:
Assistance is helping someone with something they are struggling with or cannot do on their own, while service refers to a job or task that is done to benefit someone else.

For example, assistance would be helping an elderly person with their groceries or tutoring a classmate in math. Service might be working at a restaurant or providing repair work on a car.

Assistance is typically more personal, while service is more transactional. Both words are applicable in different situations depending on what type of help or work is needed.

Care.wordDefinition:
Care refers to the attention, protection, and nurturing provided to someone or something. It is applicable in contexts where one is looking after the physical or emotional well-being of another person, animal, or thing.

Care is about providing love and attention, while service is about completing a task or meeting a need.

Examples of care could include taking care of a pet, providing emotional support to a friend, or caring for a sick family member.

Help.wordDefinition:
Help and service are both words that have a similar meaning in that they both involve assisting or aiding someone or something.

Help is used more often in personal interactions, and is typically used when someone is asking for assistance. For example, if someone needs help carrying a heavy object, you would offer to help them.

Help implies a more personal connection and a willingness to lend a hand.

In summary, while both words can refer to assisting or aiding, help is used in personal interactions while service is typically used in a business or professional setting.

Maintenance.wordDefinition:
Maintenance refers to the work of keeping something in good condition, such as fixing or replacing parts to prevent problems from happening.

Maintenance is needed to prevent damage and keep things running smoothly.

Service is a broader term that refers to tasks performed to keep something functioning properly. Service may involve maintenance tasks or provide a one-time repair or replacement.

For example, maintenance of a car might involve changing the oil and checking the brakes, while a service appointment might include these tasks as well as diagnosing and repairing a problem with the transmission.

Maintenance is a routine task that helps prevent problems, while service may be needed when something goes wrong or for more in-depth work.

Repair.wordDefinition:
Repair means fixing an object, device or machine that is not working or is broken, to restore it to its original condition.

Repair is done after something breaks, while service is done to prevent something from breaking.

Support.wordDefinition:
Support refers to assistance or aid provided to customers who have a problem with a product or service. Support could be provided through after-sales service, technical assistance, or consulting services.

Service is about providing what the customer wants, while support is about helping the customer after they have purchased a product or service.

Tune.wordDefinition:
Tune refers to adjusting or fine-tuning something to improve its performance. It's most commonly used in relation to musical instruments or engines.

For example, someone might tune a guitar to make sure it sounds good, or a mechanic might tune a car engine to improve its fuel efficiency.

Service is about maintenance and care, whereas tune is about enhancing performance.

quotes.Text: I want a president with a record of public service: someone whose life's work shows our children that we don't chase form and fortune for ourselves; we fight to give everyone a chance to succeed.
quotes.Title: American First Lady
quotes.Name: Michelle Obama

quotes.Text: Joy can only be real if people look upon their life as a service and have a definite object in life outside themselves and their personal happiness.
quotes.Title: Russian Novelist
quotes.Name: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.Text: Enjoy your time in public service. It may well be one of the most interesting and challenging times of your life.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Donald Rumsfeld

quotes.Text: Our mission is to connect every person in the world. You don't do that by having a service people pay for.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Mark Zuckerberg

quotes.Text: When I use my strength in the service of my vision it makes no difference whether or not I am afraid.
quotes.Title: American Poet
quotes.Name: Audre Lorde

quotes.Text: Protecting the USPS means protecting the essential services it provides our nation.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Lucy McBath

quotes.Text: Fiction is a lie that is told in the service of truth.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Tim O'Brien

quotes.Text: I've only paid lip service to a spiritual life.
quotes.Title: British Musician
quotes.Name: Sting

quotes.Text: I want to get paid for my services.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Jorge Masvidal
